Package edu.kit.kastel.mcse.ardoco.core.common.util.wordsim.vector

Class VectorUtils

java.lang.Object
edu.kit.kastel.mcse.ardoco.core.common.util.wordsim.vector.VectorUtils
public class VectorUtils extends Object
Some utility functions for double and float vectors.

  • Method Details

    • cosineSimilarity

      public static double cosineSimilarity(double[] firstVec, double[] secondVec)
      Calculates the cosine similarity between the two given vectors. If both vectors are zero, the resulting similarity is 1.0. If only one of the vectors is zero, the resulting similarity is 0.0.
      Parameters:
      firstVec - the first vector
      secondVec - the second vector
      Returns:
      the cosine similarity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors have different lengths

    • cosineSimilarity

      public static double cosineSimilarity(float[] firstVec, float[] secondVec)
      Calculates the cosine similarity between the two given vectors. The two given vectors must have the same length.
      Parameters:
      firstVec - the first vector
      secondVec - the second vector
      Returns:
      the cosine similarity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors have different lengths

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(double[] vector)
      Checks whether the given vector contains any non-zero numbers.
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector to check
      Returns:
      true if the given vector either has no entries or if the only entries are zero

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(float[] vector)
      Checks whether the given vector contains any non-zero numbers.
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector to check
      Returns:
      true if the given vector either has no entries or if the only entries are zero

    • add

      public static void add(double[] result, double[] toAdd)
      Adds the given vectors together and stores the resulting vector in the first argument. The two given vectors must have the same length.
      Parameters:
      result - the first vector that will also be the result vector after the addition
      toAdd - the second vector

    • scale

      public static void scale(double[] vector, double scalar)
      Scales the given vector by the given scalar.
      Parameters:
      vector - the vector to scale
      scalar - the scalar
